content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

### Count & Layers:
The target structure has 10 building blocks arranged in 4 layers:
- Bottom layer: 3 red arch/tunnel pieces
- Second layer: 1 yellow rectangular piece
- Third layer: 2 green vertical rectangular pieces with 1 yellow rectangular piece on top
- Top layer: 1 orange triangular piece and 1 blue cube (to the side)

### Spatial Relationships:
- The bottom layer consists of 3 connected red arch pieces forming a track-like structure
- The second layer has a yellow horizontal rectangular block placed on top of the left red arch
- The third layer has two green vertical rectangular blocks standing on the yellow block
- Another yellow horizontal rectangular block sits on top of the green blocks
- An orange triangular block sits on top of the uppermost yellow block
- A blue cube sits on the right side of the structure, placed on the rightmost red arch piece

## Selection of Required Blocks from Dictionary

### Needed Blocks (by index):
1. Block index 1 - Red arch piece (left side)
2. Block index 2 - Red arch piece (middle)
3. Block index 3 - Red arch piece (right side)
4. Block index 7 - Blue cube
5. Block index 8 - Green vertical rectangular block (2 of these)
6. Block index 12 - Yellow horizontal rectangular block (2 of these)
7. Block index 15 - Orange triangular block

## Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 3
    Step4: Move block with index 12
    Step5: Move block with index 8
    Step6: Move block with index 8
    Step7: Move block with index 12
    Step8: Move block with index 15
    Step9: Move block with index 7
}
```

The assembly order starts with the base (red arch pieces), builds upward with the yellow supports, adds the green vertical pieces, then the yellow top platform, and finally places the orange triangle on top and the blue cube to the side.
